results.title: Correction procedures
results.brief_description: Demonstrates and provides correction techniques used when assessing written work to provide immediate feedback on children’s progress. Shows how to diagnose incorrect responses by response type, how to recognize the type of error and three basic correction procedures.

results.title: Corot 1796-1875
results.brief_description: A survey of the works of Corot, a painter of joy and happiness who opened the door for the Impressionists by mingling the dream-life of Romanticism with the clean cool lines of the classical tradition.

results.title: Coronation day
results.creator_credit: Thorold Dickinson, United Nations Films and United Nations. Office of Public Information
results.brief_description: Captures the coronation day of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on the 2nd June, 1953. Shows the procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, the coronation service, the procession back to the Palace and Her Majesty’s appearance on the balcony to watch the R.A.F. fly-past. Includes a glimpse of Sir Robert Menzies at the ceremony. Commentary by James McKechnie, script by Gerald Sanger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Thorold Dickinson, United Nations Films and United Nations. Office of Public Information

results.title: Coronation ceremony
results.creator_credit: Hindle Marriott Edgar, Central Office of Information and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: A film about the significance of the coronation ceremony. The opening sequences show, through old prints, pictures and tapestries, the history of the coronation ritual, and its gradual development to its present form. The film then gives, by means of black and white drawings, an artist’s impression of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Music composed by John Gardner and performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by John Hollingsworth. Story by Dermot Morrah, spoken by Leo Genn. Original drawings by James Gardiner and R. Jeffryes.

results.title: Cornish Valley
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Ministry of Information and Verity Films
results.brief_description: A study of family life on farms in the Coombe Valley near the border of north Cornwall and Devon, an area fairly typical of the south-west peninsula of England, with open, wind-swept uplands, deep sheltered valleys, steep slopes and small fields.

results.title: Cornice mould and fibrous plaster cast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
The architect’s drawing, paper template, zinc template, stock and horse - these are the stages that produce the tool that the plasterer will use. The stages of forming the mould are demonstrated in detail, the core and the final coat without muffle.

results.title: Cork in Portugal
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the economic importance of cork production to Portugal and its people, and describes the role of the cork worker in a changing industry. Examines the way in which cork is harvested, processed and manufactured into a wide variety of products which are used all over the world.

results.title: Coriolanus
results.brief_description: Coriolanus is the name given to an honourable but arrogant patrician, Caius Martius, after capturing the town of Corioli where a plebeian uprising has occurred. He rises to distinction, but through his pride and insincerity does not govern well. He is sent into exile by the Senators after he criticises them harshly in the Forum. Scorned, he joins forces with the uprisers and plans to sack Rome. It is only through the intervention of his wife and his mother that he revokes this decision and enters into a peace treaty with the Senators.

results.title: Coral kingdom
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The fish and corals of the Great Barrier Reef. Photographed underwater, the film shows many different shell fish and corals; box fish, king schnapper, seaworm, jellyfish, anemones and other sea creatures.

results.title: Cops, spies and private eyes
results.brief_description: Australia’s first television policeman, Terry McDermott, better known as Detective Sergeant Frank Bronson from “Homicide” narrates this documentary on the Australian cop shows which screened on commercial television from 1956-2000. Features footage from both popular long-running and short-lived series. Television shows include: Al Munch (I Found Joe Barton) ; Consider Your Verdict ; Homicide ; Hunter ; Divorce Court ; The Unloved ; Division Four ; The Linkmen ; The Long Arm ; Matlock Police ; Boney ; The Spoiler ; Vendetta ; Ryan ; Silent Number ; Shannon’s Mob ; King’s Men ; Bluey ; Case for the Defence ; Cop Shop ; Bellamy ; Waterloo Station ; Special Squad ; Rafferty’s Rules ; Skirts ; Bony ; The Feds ; Blue Heelers ; Singapore Sling ; Cody ; Halifax FP ; Water Rats ; State Coroner ; Good Guys Bad Guys ; Murder Call ; Stingers and Above the Law.
